title.narrative: Palestine into Our Hearts ? Journal discussion and exhibition in co-operation with organizations working for Palestine

description.narrative: Palestine into Our HeartsThe purpose of the project of Finnish?Arab Friendship Society (FAFS) is to increase the Finnish understanding of the Palestinian suffering that has lasted for 67 years and of the low status of the Palestinians both in Palestine and in exile. To reverse the direction that people in Finland are tired of the Middle East conflict and are no more willing comment on them. Even humanistic people have become uncertain with regard to the Gaza Strip and the Palestinians. The project is needed to challenge people to act on behalf of the rights of the Palestinian people and support the Palestinians in their difficult social and economic circumstances.The need for information has increased because the Palestinian situation darkens all the time. After the Gaza war in summer 2014 Israel's propaganda successfully managed to incriminate Hamas in Gaza and the Palestinian people when claiming that the civilian deaths during the war occured as Hamas organized human shields. According to UN and Amnesty t here is no evidence of such activities.1. FAFS will provide an opportunity for people in various organizations working for Palestineto write articles to FAFS-journal which will be published in October 2015 as an attachment of the ?Pro Peace? magazine of Fi nnish Peace Committee.2. A photo exhibition will be held in November 2015 with images taken in 2014 in the West Bank by photographer Jarkko Tiitinen under the title The refugees in their own country as well as images of photographer Ph.D. Leena Saraste und er the title ?The refugees in neighboring countries?. The latter wellknown images have been taken 1980?85 and 2005 in Lebanon and Syria. Also Saraste's book with photos and text about Palestinians in Lebanese war will be available. 3. In collaboration with the Finnish Psychologists for Social Responsibility (FiPSR) a Palestine-related discussion will be arranged around the UN proclaimed International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People November 29 2015.
